images.summary: This detail shows the FW2 retaining wall foundation detail. The retaining wall footing is 3'-6" wide and 12" thick, reinforced with six 15M continuous rebars. Bent dowels of 15M rebar are placed 36" vertically and 24" horizontally at 16" on center. Transversal bars are also 15M and 36" long, placed at 16" on center. The wall is 8" thick, made of 25 MPa concrete, with two 15M rebars at the top perimeter. Horizontal and vertical reinforcements are 15M at 16" on center. The detail includes a 6" concrete slab and specifies a steel lid as per D3. The top of the foundation and footing are clearly marked.

images.summary: This detail illustrates the FW1 foundation bump out size. The foundation includes 1/2" diameter anchor bolts spaced at 48" on center, with a sill plate on a 1/4" sill gasket. The top of the foundation is reinforced with two continuous 15M rebars, similar to all door openings. The concrete wall is 8" thick with 25 MPa strength, and the footing is 8" x 24" with 20 MPa concrete. The foundation is reinforced with horizontal and vertical 15M rebars, spaced at 36" on center. A 6" concrete slab is shown, with a 3" cover specified for the footing.

images.summary: This foundation plan provides an overall layout of the foundation for the storage shed. It includes dimensions for the building's length and width, with a total length of 140'-0" and a width of 68'-0". The plan shows foundation walls, footings, and a 6" concrete floor with 32 MPa strength. The floor is placed on a minimum 6" compacted granular 'A' on undisturbed soil. Rebar details include a 3/8" plate welded to three 10M x 12" rebars, anchored to the wall, and 60mmx6mm beams welded with a 1/4" fillet. Element callouts include FW1, FW2, FW3, FW4, C1, C2, and L1.

images.summary: This main floor plan shows the layout of the ground floor for the storage shed. It includes dimensions consistent with the foundation plan, with a total length of 140'-0". The plan details exterior walls, door openings, and a 6" concrete floor with 32 MPa strength. The floor is placed on a minimum 6" compacted granular 'A' on undisturbed soil. The plan specifies a 6" concrete suspended slab above, with rebar grids in concave corners. Lintel details are provided, and stairs and guards are as per OBC. Element callouts include W1, W2, L3, and L5.

The platform is reinforced as per FW3, with HSS beams and columns specified at various spacings. The beams are 60mm x 6mm, placed at 5 inches on center for the 3-HSS beams and 11 inches on center for others unless noted. The steel base plate measures 8 inches by 8 inches by 1/2 inch. Wedge bolts (2 - Powers 5/8" x 4") are used for anchoring. The note specifies venting, lighting, and access requirements below the steel platform, with all steel welded unless noted otherwise. The scale is 1/4" = 1'-0".

images.location: Ground Floor – Slat floor detail for tractor support
images.text_verbatim:
WALL AS PER PLAN
MIN. 16' LONG HSS 60mm x 6mm TYP.
TRACTOR
5460 MASSEY FERGUSON DIMENSIONS & SPECIFICATIONS
- WHEELBASE: 100.5"
- LENGTH: 169.3"
- WIDTH: 79.3"
- HEIGHT (CAB): 109.1"
- TIRE WIDTH: 16"
- WEIGHT: 4524 kg. (MAX.)
NOTES:
-TRACTOR TIRES MUST BE SUPPORTED BY 3-HSS 60mm x 6mm @ 5" o.c.
-ALL OTHER HSS 60mm x 6mm BEAMS SHALL BE 11" o.c. (MAX.)
-ALL HSS 60mm x 6mm BEAMS SHALL BE MIN. 16' LONG (I.E. 2 SPAN CONTINUOUS OVER HSS 3"x3"x1/4" BEAMS)
-MAX. STORAGE LOAD FOR STRAW BALES 100 PSF
-MIN. 300W STEEL
-STEEL ANCHORS TO BE HDG
D1 SLAT FLOOR DETAIL
SCALE: 1/4" = 1'-0"
images.summary: This slat floor detail, labeled D1, is designed to support a tractor with specific dimensions and weight. The tractor tires are supported by 3-HSS 60mm x 6mm beams spaced at 5 inches on center. Other HSS beams are spaced at a maximum of 11 inches on center and must be at least 16 feet long. The beams are continuous over HSS 3"x3"x1/4" beams. The maximum storage load for straw bales is 100 PSF, and the steel used must be a minimum of 300W, with steel anchors being hot-dip galvanized (HDG). The scale is 1/4" = 1'-0".

This roof plan provides an overall layout of the roof structure, including trusses and lateral bracing. The plan is scaled at 1/16" = 1'-0" and includes grid references 1 through 5. The roof pitch is indicated as 4/12. The plan ensures proper load distribution and structural integrity for the roof system.

BOTTOM CONNECTION
images.summary: This detail shows a B2 stud wall double brace configuration. It includes double solid blocking between studs, with fastening instructions using nails through the face and into each block. The notes specify continuous nail size and end stud connection to the plate, avoiding notches in studs. Nail spacing is approximately 48 inches apart, with a minimum spacing of 3/8 inch. The detail includes top and bottom connection specifications, with a 3/8" x 3" wedge anchor at each brace location. The drawing is not to scale (N.T.S.).

images.summary: This section view, labeled as Cross Section A-A, provides a detailed look at the structural components of the building. The section includes notes on roof truss placement, with trusses located directly over wall stud spacing. The roof consists of 29 gauge steel with 2x4 strapping at 22" o.c. and engineered roof trusses at 48" o.c. The wall construction includes 2'-0"x 2'-0" 15M bent dowels at 16" o.c. and a 6" suspended slab with 15M reinforcement each way at 12" o.c. The foundation features a 6" concrete floor over 6" compacted 'A' granular material. The scale of the section is 1/4" = 1'-0".

The plan details its position relative to existing structures, including an existing barn and multiple sheds. Property lines are clearly marked, ensuring the new construction fits within the designated area. Dimensions such as 100'-0", 40'-0", 24'-0", and 412'-0" are provided to indicate distances and clearances between structures and property boundaries. This comprehensive overview facilitates coordination with existing facilities on the site.

ANCHOR DIAGONAL BRACE TO STRUT @ BOTH ENDS WITH FOUR 3 1/4" NAILS
BUTT 2x4 LATERALS @ ALL SPLICE LOCATIONS. ENSURE BUTT JOINT IS TIGHT & CENTERED ON TRUSS WEB
LAP 2x4 DIAGONAL (MIN. 2 TRUSSES) TO ENSURE DIAGONAL BRACE EXTENDS COMPLETELY FROM TOP CHORD TO BOTTOM CHORD OF TRUSS (AS REQUIRED)
TRUSS TOP CHORD
TRUSS WEB MEMBER
TRUSS BOTTOM CHORD
images.summary: This detailed diagram illustrates the truss bracing system for a roof structure. It specifies the use of 2x4 struts, each 5'-0" long, positioned at the top and bottom of the truss, secured with two 3 1/4" nails at each truss web member. The diagram also details the anchoring of 2x4 diagonal braces to laterals with four 3 1/4" nails at the intersection of truss webs and laterals. The maximum spacing for bracing is specified as 48'-0" by the brace designer. Additional notes include the use of diagonal "X" braces on the opposite side of trusses at end walls and other specified locations, ensuring structural integrity. The diagram emphasizes the importance of tight butt joints and proper lap of diagonal braces across a minimum of two trusses, extending from the top chord to the bottom chord of the truss.
